Workgroup.Endpoint.Port.description: The custom port to use when connecting to a workgroup. Valid port ranges are 5431-5455 and 8191-8215. The default is 5439.

Workgroup.SecurityGroupIds.description: An array of security group IDs to associate with the workgroup.

Workgroup.CreationDate.description: The creation date of the workgroup.

Workgroup.PubliclyAccessible.description: A value that specifies whether the workgroup can be accessible from a public network.

Workgroup.WorkgroupArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that links to the workgroup.

Workgroup.EnhancedVpcRouting.description: The value that specifies whether to enable enhanced virtual private cloud (VPC) routing, which forces Amazon Redshift Serverless to route traffic through your VPC.

Workgroup.WorkgroupId.description: The unique identifier of the workgroup.

Workgroup.NamespaceName.description: The namespace the workgroup is associated with.

Workgroup.Endpoint.Address.description: The DNS address of the VPC endpoint.

Workgroup.SubnetIds.description: An array of subnet IDs the workgroup is associated with.

Workgroup.TrackName.description: The name of the track for the workgroup.

ParameterKey.description: The key of the parameter. The options are `datestyle` , `enable_user_activity_logging` , `query_group` , `search_path` , `max_query_execution_time` , and `require_ssl` .

ParameterValue.description: The value of the parameter to set.

ConfigParameter.description: A array of parameters to set for more control over a serverless database.

Address.description: The DNS address of the VPC endpoint.

Port.description: The port that Amazon Redshift Serverless listens on.

NetworkInterfaceId.description: The unique identifier of the network interface.

PrivateIpAddress.description: The IPv4 address of the network interface within the subnet.

SubnetId.description: The unique identifier of the subnet.

NetworkInterface.description: Contains information about a network interface in an Amazon Redshift Serverless managed VPC endpoint.

Level.description: The target price performance level for the workgroup. Valid values include 1, 25, 50, 75, and 100. These correspond to the price performance levels LOW_COST, ECONOMICAL, BALANCED, RESOURCEFUL, and HIGH_PERFORMANCE.

Status.description: Whether the price performance target is enabled for the workgroup.

PerformanceTarget.description: An object that represents the price performance target settings for the workgroup.

NetworkInterfaces.description: One or more network interfaces of the endpoint. Also known as an interface endpoint.

VpcEndpointId.description: The connection endpoint ID for connecting to Amazon Redshift Serverless.

VpcId.description: The VPC identifier that the endpoint is associated with.

VpcEndpoint.description: The connection endpoint for connecting to Amazon Redshift Serverless through the proxy.

BaseCapacity.description: The base data warehouse capacity of the workgroup in Redshift Processing Units (RPUs).

ConfigParameters.description: An array of parameters to set for advanced control over a database. The options are `auto_mv` , `datestyle` , `enable_case_sensitive_identifier` , `enable_user_activity_logging` , `query_group` , `search_path` , `require_ssl` , `use_fips_ssl` , and query monitoring metrics that let you define performance boundaries. For more information about query monitoring rules and available metrics, see [Query monitoring metrics for Amazon Redshift Serverless](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/dg/cm-c-wlm-query-monitoring-rules.html#cm-c-wlm-query-monitoring-metrics-serverless) .

CreationDate.description: The creation date of the workgroup.

Endpoint.description: The endpoint that is created from the workgroup.

EnhancedVpcRouting.description: The value that specifies whether to enable enhanced virtual private cloud (VPC) routing, which forces Amazon Redshift Serverless to route traffic through your VPC.

MaxCapacity.description: The maximum data-warehouse capacity Amazon Redshift Serverless uses to serve queries. The max capacity is specified in RPUs.

NamespaceName.description: The namespace the workgroup is associated with.

PricePerformanceTarget.description: An object that represents the price performance target settings for the workgroup.

PubliclyAccessible.description: A value that specifies whether the workgroup can be accessible from a public network.

SecurityGroupIds.description: An array of security group IDs to associate with the workgroup.

SubnetIds.description: An array of subnet IDs the workgroup is associated with.

TrackName.description: The name of the track for the workgroup.

WorkgroupArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that links to the workgroup.

WorkgroupId.description: The unique identifier of the workgroup.

Workgroup.description: The collection of computing resources from which an endpoint is created.

description: The collection of compute resources in Amazon Redshift Serverless.

BaseCapacity.description: The base compute capacity of the workgroup in Redshift Processing Units (RPUs).

ConfigParameters.description: A list of parameters to set for finer control over a database. Available options are `datestyle` , `enable_user_activity_logging` , `query_group` , `search_path` , `max_query_execution_time` , and `require_ssl` .

EnhancedVpcRouting.description: The value that specifies whether to enable enhanced virtual private cloud (VPC) routing, which forces Amazon Redshift Serverless to route traffic through your VPC.

MaxCapacity.description: The maximum data-warehouse capacity Amazon Redshift Serverless uses to serve queries. The max capacity is specified in RPUs.

NamespaceName.description: The namespace the workgroup is associated with.

Port.description: The custom port to use when connecting to a workgroup. Valid port ranges are 5431-5455 and 8191-8215. The default is 5439.

PricePerformanceTarget.description: An object that represents the price performance target settings for the workgroup.

PubliclyAccessible.description: A value that specifies whether the workgroup can be accessible from a public network.

RecoveryPointId.description: The recovery point id to restore from.

SecurityGroupIds.description: A list of security group IDs to associate with the workgroup.

SnapshotArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the snapshot to restore from.

SnapshotName.description: The snapshot name to restore from.

SnapshotOwnerAccount.description: The owner AWS ; account of the snapshot.

SubnetIds.description: A list of subnet IDs the workgroup is associated with.

Tags.description: The map of the key-value pairs used to tag the workgroup.

TrackName.description: An optional parameter for the name of the track for the workgroup. If you don't provide a track name, the workgroup is assigned to the current track.

Workgroup.description: The collection of computing resources from which an endpoint is created.
